title: China Eximbank provides RMB 998.8 million government concessional loan for Transformation of National Analog TV into Terrestrial Digital TV Project (Linked to Project ID#60219)
description: On May 20, 2017, China Eximbank and the Government of the Republic of Congo signed a government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL NO. (2017) 06 TOTAL NO. (611)] worth RMB 998,873,400 (or $161,630,000) for the Congo Transformation of National Analog TV Into Terrestrial Digital TV Project. The GCL carries the following terms: a maturity of 20 years, a grace period of 5 years, an interest rate of 2%, a default (penalty) interest rate of 0%, a management fee of 0.50%, and a commitment fee of 0.50%. The borrower agreed to deposit project-related revenues in an escrow account to facilitate repayment. The proceeds of the GCL were to be used by the borrower to finance a commercial contract [number TB(CG)15001] worth $161,630,000 between the Government of the Republic of Congo and StarTimes Software Technology Co., Ltd, which was signed on July 15, 2015.  Then, on August 12, 2017, the lower house of Congo’s National Assembly passed the Congo Digital Television Conversion Act and agreed to create a joint venture with StarTimes — called Star Média Congo — to facilitate the implementation of the project.   There are some indications that the China Eximbank loan for the Transformation of National Analog TV into Terrestrial Digital TV Project financially underperformed vis-a-vis the original expectations of the lender. The project encountered significant implementation delays due to a fall in oil prices in 2018 and 2019, which reportedly made more difficult for the Congolese authorities to meet their outstanding debt obligations to China Eximbank. After China Eximbank and the Republic of Congo signed a debt restructuring agreement in 2019, project implementation reportedly restarted. However, in 2020, China Eximbank and the Republic of Congo signed a debt suspension agreement as part of the G-20 Debt Service Suspension Initiative (DSSI). Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend principal and interest payments due between May 1, 2020 and December 31, 2020 under multiple buyer’s credit loan (BCL) agreements and multiple government concessional loan (GCL) agreements (as captured via Project ID#95566 and ID#95571).  Debt service payments under many of these loan agreements were again deferred in 2021 (as captured via Project ID#95573, 95572, 95570, and 95568). The IMF assessed the Republic of Congo to be in debt distress in 2021, 2022, and 2023.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Radio and Television Digitization Project. The French name of this project is Projet de passage de la Télévision Nationale de l’Analogique au Numérique Terrestre or Projet TNT or Projet Télévision Numérique Terrestre (TNT). The Chinese project title is 广播电视数字整转项目. 2. The loan agreement can be accessed in its entirety via https://www.dropbox.com/s/9heipzzg1pl4jt8/2017%20China%20Eximbank%20Loan%20Agreement%20with%20the%20Republic%20of%20Congo.pdf?dl=0 or https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/20488108-cog_2017_4543. The project coordinator is Mr. Jean Médard BOKATOLA.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
China Eximbank provides RMB 998.8 million government concessional loan for Transformation of National Analog TV into Terrestrial Digital TV Project (Linked to Project ID#60219)

# Description
On May 20, 2017, China Eximbank and the Government of the Republic of Congo signed a government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL NO. (2017) 06 TOTAL NO. (611)] worth RMB 998,873,400 (or $161,630,000) for the Congo Transformation of National Analog TV Into Terrestrial Digital TV Project. The GCL carries the following terms: a maturity of 20 years, a grace period of 5 years, an interest rate of 2%, a default (penalty) interest rate of 0%, a management fee of 0.50%, and a commitment fee of 0.50%. The borrower agreed to deposit project-related revenues in an escrow account to facilitate repayment. The proceeds of the GCL were to be used by the borrower to finance a commercial contract [number TB(CG)15001] worth $161,630,000 between the Government of the Republic of Congo and StarTimes Software Technology Co., Ltd, which was signed on July 15, 2015.  Then, on August 12, 2017, the lower house of Congo’s National Assembly passed the Congo Digital Television Conversion Act and agreed to create a joint venture with StarTimes — called Star Média Congo — to facilitate the implementation of the project.   There are some indications that the China Eximbank loan for the Transformation of National Analog TV into Terrestrial Digital TV Project financially underperformed vis-a-vis the original expectations of the lender. The project encountered significant implementation delays due to a fall in oil prices in 2018 and 2019, which reportedly made more difficult for the Congolese authorities to meet their outstanding debt obligations to China Eximbank. After China Eximbank and the Republic of Congo signed a debt restructuring agreement in 2019, project implementation reportedly restarted. However, in 2020, China Eximbank and the Republic of Congo signed a debt suspension agreement as part of the G-20 Debt Service Suspension Initiative (DSSI). Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend principal and interest payments due between May 1, 2020 and December 31, 2020 under multiple buyer’s credit loan (BCL) agreements and multiple government concessional loan (GCL) agreements (as captured via Project ID#95566 and ID#95571).  Debt service payments under many of these loan agreements were again deferred in 2021 (as captured via Project ID#95573, 95572, 95570, and 95568). The IMF assessed the Republic of Congo to be in debt distress in 2021, 2022, and 2023.
justification: Project focuses on digital TV infrastructure upgrade without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Transformation of national analog TV into terrestrial digital TV, communications sector project

title: Chinese government funds access to satellite TV in ten thousand African villages project in Rep of Congo with StarTimes (linked to umbrella project #57618)
description: On December 11, 2017, government of China and government and Republic of Congo signed the letter of exchange to implement the "Access to satellite TV in ten thousand African villages" in Rep of Congo (刚果（布）万村通项目). This project is the Congo part of the overall project "Access to satellite TV in ten thousand African villages" announced by Chinese President Xi Jinping, together with the African participants of the Conference, at the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation at the Johannesburg Summit in 2015 (described in #57618). 100 villages in Congo across 12 provinces will be affected.  The StarTimes group was charged with implementing the project under the direction of the Chinese and African governments in the countries concerned. On August 31, 2018, the construction was completed, and on March 22, 2019, the handover ceremony was held. Chinese Ambassador to Gangma Ma Fulin, Gang News Media Minister Mengara, Jindeli District Head Stella Sasso, Business Counsellor Yang Peipei and others attended the ceremony.
staff_comments: This project is linked to #57618, when at the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation at the Johannesburg Summit the project: 'Access to satellite TV in ten thousand African villages' was announced. This project is separate from the Transformation of National Analog TV Into Terrestrial Digital TV Project, also implemented by StarTimes in Republic of Congo.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
Chinese government funds access to satellite TV in ten thousand African villages project in Rep of Congo with StarTimes (linked to umbrella project #57618)

# Description
On December 11, 2017, government of China and government and Republic of Congo signed the letter of exchange to implement the "Access to satellite TV in ten thousand African villages" in Rep of Congo (刚果（布）万村通项目). This project is the Congo part of the overall project "Access to satellite TV in ten thousand African villages" announced by Chinese President Xi Jinping, together with the African participants of the Conference, at the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation at the Johannesburg Summit in 2015 (described in #57618). 100 villages in Congo across 12 provinces will be affected.  The StarTimes group was charged with implementing the project under the direction of the Chinese and African governments in the countries concerned. On August 31, 2018, the construction was completed, and on March 22, 2019, the handover ceremony was held. Chinese Ambassador to Gangma Ma Fulin, Gang News Media Minister Mengara, Jindeli District Head Stella Sasso, Business Counsellor Yang Peipei and others attended the ceremony.
justification: Project focuses on providing satellite TV access for social development purposes, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Access to satellite TV in villages, social development focus, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 346 million grant for Parliament Building Construction Project
description: In 2017, China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) provided an RMB 346 million ($58 million) grant to the Republic of Congo for the Parliament Building Construction Project. This project involved the construction of a new parliament building (Palais du Parlement) in the capital city of Brazzaville. The building will include seven meeting rooms with 50 seats each, a press room, two VIP lounges, two permanent and auxiliary committee rooms and a health care room. The building will also include 500 seats for members of the National Assembly and 300 seats for the members of the Congolese Senate, as well as archive rooms and libraries.   Beijing Institute of Architectural Design and Research Co., Ltd. and Shenyang Engineering Supervision Consulting Co., Ltd. are responsible for project design and supervision. Jiangsu Provincial Construction LTD is the contractor responsible for implementation. It was awarded a MOFCOM contract in December 2016. The project officially commenced on April 30, 2017. Then, on May 22, 2017, Congolese President Sassou Nguesso and a delegation from MOFCOM attended a foundation laying ceremony. Then, on January 12, 2018, the Chinese Ambassador to the Republic of Congo conducted a project site visit.   The project was originally expected to reach completion in August 2020. However, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, construction was temporarily suspended. The project was officially handed over on March 3, 2021.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 援刚果（布）新议会大厦项目 or 援刚新议会大厦项目. The French project title is la construction du nouveau siège du Parlement de Brazzaville.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 346 million grant for Parliament Building Construction Project

# Description
In 2017, China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) provided an RMB 346 million ($58 million) grant to the Republic of Congo for the Parliament Building Construction Project. This project involved the construction of a new parliament building (Palais du Parlement) in the capital city of Brazzaville. The building will include seven meeting rooms with 50 seats each, a press room, two VIP lounges, two permanent and auxiliary committee rooms and a health care room. The building will also include 500 seats for members of the National Assembly and 300 seats for the members of the Congolese Senate, as well as archive rooms and libraries.   Beijing Institute of Architectural Design and Research Co., Ltd. and Shenyang Engineering Supervision Consulting Co., Ltd. are responsible for project design and supervision. Jiangsu Provincial Construction LTD is the contractor responsible for implementation. It was awarded a MOFCOM contract in December 2016. The project officially commenced on April 30, 2017. Then, on May 22, 2017, Congolese President Sassou Nguesso and a delegation from MOFCOM attended a foundation laying ceremony. Then, on January 12, 2018, the Chinese Ambassador to the Republic of Congo conducted a project site visit.   The project was originally expected to reach completion in August 2020. However, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, construction was temporarily suspended. The project was officially handed over on March 3, 2021.
justification: Project is focused on government infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of parliament building with meeting rooms, VIP lounges, healthcare room, and library facilities

title: Chinese provides USD 700,000 cash grant for fighting small pox
description: On May 20, 2017, the Chinese Vice Minister of Commerce, Qian Keming, visited Brazzaville and signed five cooperation agreements with Republic of Congo, including a USD 700,000 cash assistance for fighting small pox.   The other four cooperation agreements are: a transition from analogue to digital television(#57584), the 3rd phase of the national telecommunications coverage(#57531), staffing of the general hospital equipment Loandjili Pointe-Noire(#57868), and a donation of RMB 100 million for unspecified purposes(#57955).
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese provides USD 700,000 cash grant for fighting small pox

# Description
On May 20, 2017, the Chinese Vice Minister of Commerce, Qian Keming, visited Brazzaville and signed five cooperation agreements with Republic of Congo, including a USD 700,000 cash assistance for fighting small pox.   The other four cooperation agreements are: a transition from analogue to digital television(#57584), the 3rd phase of the national telecommunications coverage(#57531), staffing of the general hospital equipment Loandjili Pointe-Noire(#57868), and a donation of RMB 100 million for unspecified purposes(#57955).
justification: Cash grant specifically for healthcare purposes with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: USD 700,000 cash assistance for fighting small pox, healthcare focus

title: Chinese government donates equipments for Loandjili General Hospital in Pointe-Noire
description: On May 20, 2017, the Chinese Vice Minister of Commerce visited Brazzaville and signed a cooperation agreement to provide equipment for the Loandjili General Hospital in Pointe-Noire(黑角卢旺基里医院). The exact contents and value of the equipment is unknown.  The other four cooperation agreements were also signed: cash assistance for monkey pox(see project #57818), a transition from analogue to digital television(see project #57584), the 3rd phase of the national telecommunications coverage(see project #57531), and a donation of RMB 100 million for unspecified purposes( aee project #57955).  The Loandjili General Hospital was originally built with Chinese Aid, for more details see project #57864.

The Loandjili General Hospital was originally built with Chinese Aid, for more details see project #57864.

title: Chinese Embassy donates teaching materials to Pierre Passy Middle School in 2017
description: On November 27, 2017, the Chinese Embassy donated teaching materials to Pierre Passy Junior High School in Republic of Congo (驻刚果（布）大使夏煌向皮埃尔·帕西初中捐赠教学物资). The Vice President of the Constitutional Court, the former ambassador to China, Passi, and Pierre Passi Junior High School Principal Binia attended the material handover ceremony.
combined_text:

The Vice President of the Constitutional Court, the former ambassador to China, Passi, and Pierre Passi Junior High School Principal Binia attended the material handover ceremony.

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 5.5 million grant for Sino-Congolese Ophthalmology Center Project
description: In April 2017, the Director of the China’s Health Planning Commission signed an intergovernmental agreement with the Republic of Congo’s Minister of Health regarding the Sino-Congolese Ophthalmology Center Project. Then, in May 2018, the Tianjin Ophthalmology Hospital signed a counterpart assistance agreement with the Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital (or Hôpital d'amitié sino-congolaise de M’Filou or l'Hôpital de base de Mfilou) regarding this project, which was supported by a grant worth RMB 5.5 million.   This project involved the installation of an Ophthalmology Center at the Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital (or Hôpital d'amitié sino-congolaise de M’Filou or l'Hôpital de base de Mfilou) in M’Filou, which is located in the 7th arrondissement of the capital city of Brazzaville. It involved, among other things, the training of local ophthalmologists. The center’s opening ceremony took place on December 12, 2018.
staff_comments: This project is also known as the Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital Ophthalmology Center Project. The French project title is Centre d'Ophtalmologie Sino-Congolais a Brazzaville. The Chinese project title is 中国—刚果（布）眼科中心.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 5.5 million grant for Sino-Congolese Ophthalmology Center Project

# Description
In April 2017, the Director of the China’s Health Planning Commission signed an intergovernmental agreement with the Republic of Congo’s Minister of Health regarding the Sino-Congolese Ophthalmology Center Project. Then, in May 2018, the Tianjin Ophthalmology Hospital signed a counterpart assistance agreement with the Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital (or Hôpital d'amitié sino-congolaise de M’Filou or l'Hôpital de base de Mfilou) regarding this project, which was supported by a grant worth RMB 5.5 million.   This project involved the installation of an Ophthalmology Center at the Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital (or Hôpital d'amitié sino-congolaise de M’Filou or l'Hôpital de base de Mfilou) in M’Filou, which is located in the 7th arrondissement of the capital city of Brazzaville. It involved, among other things, the training of local ophthalmologists. The center’s opening ceremony took place on December 12, 2018.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare infrastructure and training, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Ophthalmology center installation, training of local ophthalmologists, healthcare sector focus

title: Chinese Government dispatches 24th medical team to Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital and Loandjili General Hospital
description: Since 1967, the Chinese Government has been dispatching medical teams to the Republic of Congo every two years. Tianjin City is responsible for sending the teams. In 2017, the Chinese Government dispatched the 24th Chinese medical team to the Republic of Congo [第24批援刚（布）医疗队].   The 33-member team was stationed at Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital (or Hôpital d'amitié sino-congolaise de M’Filou or l'Hôpital de base de Mfilou) and Loandjili General Hospital (or Hôpital Loandjili or Hôpital Général De Loandjili). The Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital is located in M’Filou, which is the 7th arrondissement of the capital city of Brazzaville. Loandjili General Hospital is located in the city of in Pointe-Noire. It completed its term of service between August 11, 2017 and August 2018
combined_text:

# Title

# Description
Since 1967, the Chinese Government has been dispatching medical teams to the Republic of Congo every two years. Tianjin City is responsible for sending the teams. In 2017, the Chinese Government dispatched the 24th Chinese medical team to the Republic of Congo [第24批援刚（布）医疗队].   The 33-member team was stationed at Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital (or Hôpital d'amitié sino-congolaise de M’Filou or l'Hôpital de base de Mfilou) and Loandjili General Hospital (or Hôpital Loandjili or Hôpital Général De Loandjili). The Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital is located in M’Filou, which is the 7th arrondissement of the capital city of Brazzaville. Loandjili General Hospital is located in the city of in Pointe-Noire. It completed its term of service between August 11, 2017 and August 2018
justification: Project involves medical assistance and healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Dispatch of medical team to hospitals, healthcare sector focus

title: Chinese Embassy donates office equipment to Ministry of Justice
description: On November 30, 2017, the Embassy in Congo (Brazza) donated office equipment to the Ministry of Justice (驻刚果（布）大使馆向刚司法部捐赠办公设备). Ambassador Xia Huang, Minister of Justice Binanga, representatives of Chinese companies and overseas Chinese and heads of various departments of the Ministry of Justice attended the donation ceremony.

title: Chinese government donates AIDS supplies and agricultural equipment to Congolese Relief Foundation
description: On December 1, 2017, Chinese Embassy in Republic of Congo donated anti-AIDS supplies and agricultural equipment to the Congolese Relief Foundation led by the President of Congo's wife, Mikolo (向刚果救助基金会捐赠抗击艾滋病物资和农用器具). More than 100 people, including Ambassador Xia Huang to Congo, Mongo, Secretary-General of the Congo Relief Foundation, representatives of diplomatic envoys and international organizations, and Mrs. Xia Huang’s wife Liu Hong, and business counselor Yang Peipei, attended the donation ceremony.  The value of the donation is unknown.
combined_text:

evidence: Donation of anti-AIDS supplies and agricultural equipment, humanitarian focus
